title: SLIM Sri Lanka
description:
The Sri Lanka Institute of Marketing (SLIM) is the apex body for Sri Lankan Marketers, which was founded in 1970 and subsequently incorporated by an act of Parliament in 1980, recognizing it as the National Body for Marketing and a ‚Äònot-for-profit‚Äô organization.

We are mandated to uplift the Marketing profession in Sri Lanka, thus providing Marketing studies and conducting many National level events and projects. SLIM is governed by a Council of Management and an Executive Committee headed by a President and comprising of professionals from numerous industries in an honorary capacity. We take pride in organizing National level events consecutively on an annual basis, which are popular among the Sri Lankan corporates and public alike.

title: GLORY Sri Lanka
description:
Glory has been rocking Sri Lankan music fans since they first came onto the scene with their funk. They have been together since they first formed the band as friends back in 2008 jamming their instruments in school. Their lives and shared passion for music eventually turned their jamming sessions to serious practice sessions and it didn‚Äôt take long for them to realize that music was right at the top of the few things that truly made them happy.

Music has never been just a career path for them, it‚Äôs always been their lifestyle. They are known for a musical style that combines elements of Pop, Classics, Rock n Roll, Soul, Funk, Classic Rock, RnB, Reggae, Country, Rhumba Flamenco, Blues and Jazz. Equally associating with all the music genres and styles, they also cover songs in an acapella form which is not seen in Sri Lankan music culture.

title: Sri Lanka Inventors Commission
description:
The Sri Lanka Inventors Commission is a Statutory Body which came into operation on 1st August in 1987 by virtue of the powers vested in the Sri Lanka Inventors Incentives Act No 53 of 1979. As per the Act, the Sri Lanka Inventors Commission shall consist of a Commissioner and two Assistant Commissioners appointed by the Cabinet of Ministers on the recommendation of the Minister of the line Ministry.

Currently, we are an Institute under the purview of the State Ministry of Skills Development, Vocational Education, Research & Innovations

State Ministry of Skills Development, Vocational Education, Research & Innovations

Ministry of Education

title: The Voice Sri Lanka
description:
The Voice Sri Lanka

The Voice One of the most successful reality TV formats in the world. Extremely successful in 180 countries. 
SRI LANKA‚ÄôS NEWEST TELEVISION EXPERIENCE - The Voice Sri Lanka

The Voice is an international reality television singing competition franchise of Dutch origin. It is based on the reality singing competition The Voice of Holland, which was originally created by Dutch television producer John de Mol. The show's format features five stages of competition: producers' auditions, blind auditions, battle rounds, knockouts (since 2012), and live performance shows.

A combined 438 singers have won The Voice, The Voice Kids, The Voice Teens and The Voice Senior in 145 countries/regions. Each winner is given a recording contract, a monetary prize, and a title as that nation's "Voice".

title: Village Kitchen SRI LANKA
description:
I'm Mayomi and I live in litle village near tha . I'm a busy house wife with two kids. Living and cooking in traditional way is my favourite thing. In my county every lady have a traditionaly made kitchen and we regularly cook in a wood stoves. In my videos you can see the beautiful life I'm living with my kids. 

I always grow and pick our own vegetables that's why the food I is fresh and tasteful.
I like to try cooking other countries food too.

My children are as good as me for housework and cooking , specialy my daughter , she always try new food that belong to ather cultures. 

 If you like the culture of sri lankans you are invited to my channel . This is the free traesure trove of your favourite foods.

title: GFU Sri Lanka
description:
GFU was inaugurated on 5th September 1948. The first Director wasan Italian.

The unit was entrusted with the task to produce documentary and news coverages on events with national importance. These documentaries were used for public education in different parts of the country. Production, editing, colour laboratory, sound unit and the film hall, and archives are some of the facilities the GFU has at its disposal.

Opening the colour laboratory was a turning point. With German assistance the laboratory was converted to use colour in 1981.

The Film Archive is one of the valuable resources of the Department. All documentaries produced by the GFU are preserved by converting into DVDs. Scenes of these old films are provided to media institutions on a fee rated depending on the length of the negative. Providing films for external demonstration is another task of this unit.

title: CAL Sri Lanka
description:
Delivering our brand promise to you, ‚ÄúYour Partner in Financial Freedom‚Äù.
 
We, CAL (Capital Alliance Holdings Limited), one of the leading investment banks in Sri Lanka with over two decades of expertise, believe that our success lies in achieving our core values; understanding the markets and our clients, driving growth in Frontier Economies through Capital Markets, providing the best, most relevant, and unique investment solutions, and bringing innovations to your investment journey.
 
Since October 2000, as a full-fledged investment bank providing capital market solutions. we specialize in offering a range of investment solutions tailored to meet diverse financial needs. Our services include Unit Trust Funds, Treasuries (Bills & Bonds), Stock Brokering Solutions backed by a multiple award-winning research wing, and Initial Public Offerings (IPOs).

title: Spoken English Sri Lanka
description:
English is not the most spoken language in the world but, it is the official language in 53 countries and is spoken as a first language by around 400 million people worldwide. But that‚Äôs not all, it is also the most common second language in the world. According to the British Council, by 2020 about two billion people in the world will be studying English.

Therefore, it is highly likely that if you meet someone from another country, you will both be able to speak English. It gives you an open door to the world and helps you communicate with global citizens.

title: Parliament of Sri Lanka
description:
Welcome to the Parliament of Sri Lanka

Our social media channels share with you about what‚Äôs happening at the heart of SL democracy and how you can be a part of it. You are warmly welcome to follow #SLparliament on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram and YouTube.

We appreciate and welcome your feedback if you‚Äôve had a great experience visiting the Parliament or about your involvement in our events. And specially, if something‚Äôs not right do not hesitate to tell us so we can fix it. We will to the best of our abilities assist you in your requests.

Our social media team is here to answer questions and help with anything related to #SLparliament. We‚Äôre here from 8.30 am - 4.00 pm, Monday to Friday. 

We‚Äôll respond to you as soon as we can in that time frame.
